title: cafter
author: cafter
content: i receive this error every time i click preview. i try to solve this error every time i edit this thread but waste my half an hour without any results. i don't know which tag is causing this error: "INVALID BBCODE: close of unopened tag in table (1)"Code:[b][size=13pt]Overview Of Bitcointalk Contests And Giveaways[/size][/b][hr][b]Don't ever miss any opportunity to win.[/b]Here you can see information about ongoing contests, giveaways, and free stuffs in global boards including games and rounds board. This thread will help you to find specific giveaway to participate in, without scrolling ever ending list of threads. comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Remove from the table and it will work. Which means you have to use two different replies to make your posts.I remember when I was making this thread I encountered same issue and I even had to test it on an online bbcode viewer and it worked perfectly. Just create a thread at Archival board and try to split it into two and test it out if it will work or not, that was how I did mine back then. Quote from: theymos on May 10, 2016, 04:25:11 PMYeah, that's what it is. Posts over 65535 bytes get cut off at 65535 bytes. If that makes the BBcode invalid in certain ways, then you get the INVALID BBCODE error.Also, note that a byte is different from a character. Because SMF stores "special" characters in a particularly space-inefficient way, each Russian character uses about 6 bytes, and each line break also uses 6 bytes.Hereâ€™s another findingâ€¦

comments.author: shahzadafzal
comments.body: In your code in second table second last row before first td there are some invalid character looks like spaces remove it and it will work fine. Edit: Glad you already found it BTW table (1) is referring to second table, starting first table at index 0, so next time you can figure out which table have problem.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: These are some of the common errors while working with tables it needs to be carefully inserted otherwise there will be code error display, mostly if such errors persist you need to restarts the whole process to be able to trace out the error part especially if you not that conversant with table works.
